intro: Fimbristylis podocarpa var. tuberculata, commonly known as the tuberculate flat sedge, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. It typically grows in wetland or swampy areas, preferring moist soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic and semi-aquatic ecosystems.
